results.title: Kevin Alec
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Children of Canada”.
In the mountainous country near Lillooet, British Columbia, eleven-year-old Kevin Alec of the Fountain Indian Reserve learns to make fishnets with his grandfather, and skin and tan hides with his aunt. He goes fishing with his grandmother and horseback riding with his brother. Life is full of wonderful things to do and to learn. Will Kevin eventually abandon his Indian way of life or will it be a source of continuing enrichment?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Veronica
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Nine-year-old Veronica Makarewicz leads a double life. Born of Polish parents, she dances Polish dances, goes twice weekly to a Polish school, and talks to Polish customers in her parents’ bakery. But this film shows that she is also very Canadian.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beverly Shaffer, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: My name is Susan Yee
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Children of Canada”.
A piquant view of downtown Montreal as it appears to a young Chinese-Canadian. Not all guides are as perceptive as Susan, or as outspoken. At home, at school, at play on the Mountain, she has a sharp eye for adult foibles. The result is a meeting with Susan and her city that is enlightening and amusing.

results.title: Home and away (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
The most important event in the life of most five year olds is starting school. With this comes a widening of relationships to include teachers and friends. It is not always an easy step and some children are disturbed by it.

results.title: Mother and child
results.creator_credit: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
Explores the changing relationship between mother and child from birth to school age. Considers two common family crises involving separation - when either mother or child goes to hospital and the arrival of a new baby. Narrated by Hugh David.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and BBC-TV

results.title: Making sense [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
A new born baby has all the five senses needed to perceive his outside world, but making something of it is a slow developmental process. This program constructs situations and experiments to demonstrate how a child sees and makes sense of the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Power of speech [B/W]
results.creator_credit: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children Growing Up”.
Discusses the early development of speech in children. Part three of the series considers the development of speech through the use of words. This is partly innate and partly due to training. Includes the problem of the late talking child, and discusses how it can be managed, based on the current ideas of language development.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francis Fuchs, Eurfron Gwynne Jones and BBC
